name: github
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing github cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`github` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-github).

anonymous.description:
Authenticate without a token. When `anonymous`is true, the provider will not be able to access resourcesthat require
authentication.

individual.description: Run outside an organization. When `individual`is true, the provider will run outside the scope of anorganization.

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate.

organization.description: The GitHub organization name to manage. If `individual` is false, `organization` is required.

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitHub. If `anonymous` is false, `token` is required.

groupDescription.description: The description of the IdP group.

groupId.description: The ID of the IdP group.

groupName.description: The name of the IdP group.

eventsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's events.

followersUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's followers.

followingUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for those following the collaborator.

gistsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's gists.

htmlUrl.description: The GitHub HTML URL for the collaborator.

organizationsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's organizations.

receivedEventsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's received events.

reposUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's repositories.

siteAdmin.description: Whether the user is a GitHub admin.

starredUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's starred repositories.

subscriptionsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's subscribed repositories.

url.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator.

groupDescription.description: The description of the IdP group.

groupId.description: The ID of the IdP group.

groupName.description: The name of the IdP group.

provider.description:
The provider type for the github package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

anonymous.description:
Authenticate without a token. When `anonymous`is true, the provider will not be able to access resourcesthat require
authentication.

individual.description: Run outside an organization. When `individual`is true, the provider will run outside the scope of anorganization.

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate.

organization.description: The GitHub organization name to manage. If `individual` is false, `organization` is required.

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitHub. If `anonymous` is false, `token` is required.

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted
Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted

etag.description: An etag representing the Branch object.

ref.description: A string representing a branch reference, in the form of `refs/heads/<branch>`.

sha.description: A string storing the reference's `HEAD` commit's SHA1.

sourceBranch.description: The branch name to start from. Defaults to `master`.

sourceSha.description: The commit hash to start from. Defaults to the tip of `source_branch`. If provided, `source_branch` is ignored.

sourceBranch.description: The branch name to start from. Defaults to `master`.

sourceSha.description: The commit hash to start from. Defaults to the tip of `source_branch`. If provided, `source_branch` is ignored.

enforceAdmins.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` enforces status checks for repository administrators.

requireSignedCommits.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` requires all commits to be signed with GPG.

requiredPullRequestReviews.description: Enforce restrictions for pull request reviews. See Required Pull Request Reviews below for details.

requiredStatusChecks.description: Enforce restrictions for required status checks. See Required Status Checks below for details.

restrictions.description: Enforce restrictions for the users and teams that may push to the branch. See Restrictions below for details.

allowMergeCommit.description: Set to `false` to disable merge commits on the repository.

allowRebaseMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable rebase merges on the repository.

allowSquashMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable squash merges on the repository.

archived.description: Specifies if the repository should be archived. Defaults to `false`. **NOTE** Currently, the API does not support unarchiving.

autoInit.description: Set to `true` to produce an initial commit in the repository.

defaultBranch.description:
The name of the default branch of the repository. **NOTE:** This can only be set after a repository has already been created,
and after a correct reference has been created for the target branch inside the repository. This means a user will have to omit this parameter from the
initial repository creation and create the target branch inside of the repository prior to setting this attribute.

deleteBranchOnMerge.description: Automatically delete head branch after a pull request is merged. Defaults to `false`.

gitCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository anonymously via the git protocol.

gitignoreTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/gitignore) without the extension. For example, "Haskell".

hasDownloads.description: Set to `true` to enable the (deprecated) downloads features on the repository.

hasIssues.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Issues features
on the repository.

hasProjects.description: Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Projects features on the repository. Per the GitHub [documentation](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#create) when in an organization that has disabled repository projects it will default to `false` and will otherwise default to `true`. If you specify `true` when it has been disabled it will return an error.

hasWiki.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Wiki features on
the repository.

homepageUrl.description: URL of a page describing the project.

htmlUrl.description: URL to the repository on the web.

httpCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via HTTPS.

isTemplate.description: Set to `true` to tell GitHub that this is a template repository.

licenseTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/choosealicense.com/tree/gh-pages/_licenses) without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mpl-2.0".

private.description:
Set to `true` to create a private repository.
Repositories are created as public (e.g. open source) by default.

sshCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via SSH.

svnUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `svn checkout` to check out the repository via GitHub's Subversion protocol emulation.

template.description: Use a template repository to create this resource. See Template Repositories below for details.

topics.description: The list of topics of the repository.

github:index/repositoryCollaborator:Repo.description:
Provides a GitHub repository collaborator resource.

This resource allows you to add/remove collaborators from repositories in your
organization. Collaborators can have explicit (and differing levels of) read,
write, or administrator access to specific repositories in your organization,
without giving the user full organization membership.

When applied, an invitation will be sent to the user to become a collaborator
on a repository. When destroyed, either the invitation will be cancelled or the
collaborator will be removed from the repository.

Further documentation on GitHub collaborators:

- [Adding outside collaborators to repositories in your organization](https://help.github.com/articles/adding-outside-collaborators-to-repositories-in-your-organization/)
- [Converting an organization member to an outside collaborator](https://help.github.com/articles/converting-an-organization-member-to-an-outside-collaborator/)

{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as github from "@pulumi/github";

// Add a collaborator to a repository
const aRepoCollaborator = new github.RepositoryCollaborator("a_repo_collaborator", {
    permission: "admin",
    repository: "our-cool-repo",
    username: "SomeUser",
});
```
```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_github as github

# Add a collaborator to a repository
a_repo_collaborator = github.RepositoryCollaborator("aRepoCollaborator",
    permission="admin",
    repository="our-cool-repo",
    username="SomeUser")
```

{{% /example %}}
{{% /examples %}}

invitationId.description: ID of the invitation to be used in `github..UserInvitationAccepter`

permission.description:
The permission of the outside collaborator for the repository.
Must be one of `pull`, `push`, `maintain`, `triage` or `admin`. Defaults to `push`.

username.description: The user to add to the repository as a collaborator.

The permission of the outside collaborator for the repository.
Must be one of `pull`, `push`, `maintain`, `triage` or `admin`. Defaults to `push`.

ldapDn.description: The LDAP Distinguished Name of the group where membership will be synchronized. Only available in GitHub Enterprise.

parentTeamId.description: The ID of the parent team, if this is a nested team.

privacy.description:
The level of privacy for the team. Must be one of `secret` or `closed`.
Defaults to `secret`.

slug.description:
The slug of the created team, which may or may not differ from `name`,
depending on whether `name` contains "URL-unsafe" characters.
Useful when referencing the team in [`github..BranchProtection`](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/github/r/branch_protection.html).

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRelease.

releaseId.description: ID of the release to retrieve. Must be specified when `retrieve_by` = `id`.

releaseTag.description: Tag of the release to retrieve. Must be specified when `retrieve_by` = `tag`.

repository.description: Name of the repository to retrieve the release from.

retrieveBy.description: Describes how to fetch the release. Valid values are `id`, `tag`, `latest`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRelease.

assertsUrl.description: URL of any associated assets with the release

body.description: Contents of the description (body) of a release

draft.description: (`Boolean`) indicates whether the release is a draft

htmlUrl.description: URL directing to detailed information on the release

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

prerelease.description: (`Boolean`) indicates whether the release is a prerelease

tarballUrl.description: Download URL of a specific release in `tar.gz` format

targetCommitish.description: Commitish value that determines where the Git release is created from

uploadUrl.description: URL that can be used to upload Assets to the release

zipballUrl.description: Download URL of a specific release in `zip` format

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRepositories.

query.description: Search query. See [documentation for the search syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/understanding-the-search-syntax/).

sort.description: Sorts the repositories returned by the specified attribute. Valid values include `stars`, `fork`, and `updated`. Defaults to `updated`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRepositories.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRepository.

fullName.description: Full name of the repository (in `org/name` format).

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRepository.

allowMergeCommit.description: Whether the repository allows merge commits.

allowRebaseMerge.description: Whether the repository allows rebase merges.

allowSquashMerge.description: Whether the repository allows squash merges.

defaultBranch.description: The name of the default branch of the repository.

gitCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository anonymously via the git protocol.

hasDownloads.description: Whether the repository has Downloads feature enabled.

hasIssues.description: Whether the repository has GitHub Issues enabled.

hasProjects.description: Whether the repository has the GitHub Projects enabled.

hasWiki.description: Whether the repository has the GitHub Wiki enabled.

homepageUrl.description: URL of a page describing the project.

htmlUrl.description: URL to the repository on the web.

httpCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via HTTPS.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

sshCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via SSH.

svnUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `svn checkout` to check out the repository via GitHub's Subversion protocol emulation.

topics.description: The list of topics of the repository.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTeam.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTeam.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUser.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

siteAdmin.description: whether the user is a GitHub admin.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing github cloud resources.
